intro: Dalechampia pentaphylla, commonly known as the five-leafed dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into five lobes, giving it its common name. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are clustered in a cup-like structure called a cyathium. Dalechampia pentaphylla is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woods.
